sense.def:
To sweep an area of ground
pomeni z metlo odstraniti prah ali umazanijo s talne površine.

seg.quote: I must sweep the kitchen floor.
He swept away the broken glass.

sense.def:
To sweep things off a surface
pomeni odriniti stvari z neke površine s hitrim zamahom roke.

seg.quote: He went into the study and swept some books and papers off the couch.

sense.def:
To sweep
pomeni tudi hitro se premikati v gladki ravni črti ali krivulji.

seg.quote: He stared out at the traffic sweeping along the road.
The dog was flung aside by the panther's sweeping paw.
With a great sweep of the arm he flung the whole handful high in the air.

sense.def:
Kadar močna sila
sweeps someone along
, človeka nekam odnese.

seg.quote: She was swept out to sea by the currents.

sense.def:
Kadar ideje, prepričanja ali trditve
sweep a place
, se nekje naglo širijo.

seg.quote: ...the camping craze that is currently sweeping America.
Change sweeps through the highly industrialized countries.

sense.def:
To sweep something away
pomeni nekaj hitro in popolnoma odstraniti.

seg.quote: The matter was soon swept from his mind.

sense.def:
Kadar pogled nekega človeka ali svetloba
sweeps an area
, se premika prek nekega območja.

seg.quote: We began rushing around in the dark, sweeping the ground with our flashlights.

sense.def:
To sweep something under the carpet
pomeni poskušati preprečiti, da bi se nekaj razvedelo, navadno zato, ker je sramotno za nas.

To sweep up dirt or rubbish
pomeni potisniti prah ali smeti z metlo na kup in jih nato odstraniti.
